Fantastic Add-on!

Perhaps you could fix one of the issues with the stock display that has bothered me: The consumption level value.

A number in parenthesis is a negative number.

A number with a leading '-' character is a negative number.

The resources display confusingly uses parenthesis for both positive and negative numbers. I know it's using parenthesis to mean parenthetical, but it's still confusing.

You could replace the parenthesis with brackets (ex. [-2.55], [-], [2.55]), but it would be nicer if it were clearer that value is dropping or increasing. That tiny '-' character is easily missed.

Something like this:

Neg: <<2.55

Zero: <->

Pos: 2.55>>

Thanks for the great mod!

Rather than that, I'd personally like an option to show whether resources are charging or depleting (without the specific rate), perhaps as a small icon on the side.

I like my quantity levels in the middle of the bars, and if I enable the change rates, things get too cluttered for me. But knowing whether a resource has a positive or negative (or no) gain over time would be useful still.

How does the auto-staging works? I wanted to try it for the fun, but It doesn't seem to work - I click Arm, the button goes red "Disarm", so it's active, and says "Armed Waiting for stage...". And that's it. All of my craft don't stage automatically, no matter the staging order, even the simplest ones.

How does the auto-staging works? I wanted to try it for the fun, but It doesn't seem to work - I click Arm, the button goes red "Disarm", so it's active, and says "Armed Waiting for stage...". And that's it. All of my craft don't stage automatically, no matter the staging order, even the simplest ones.

You can see it in action in the video on the OP.

When its status says "Armed Waiting for Stage... " it is waiting for you to activate the first stage and then it should take over.

So the steps are:

  • Set the end stage number using the slider
  • Arm the autostager
  • Set your throttle where you want it
  • Hit Space Bar and it should drive away
